page.title: 02The population of Cowlinge
page.content: In the village of Cowlinge there are 101 dwellings consisting of farms, houses and cottages. The population numbers 261 and of these 51 are children (ie. under the age of 16). The local council owns 24 houses and 3 houses are second homes and are used only at weekends. The rest of the houses are privately owned. A small percentage of the population are retired professional people, and a very small percentage are agricultural workers, all other livelihoods are earned in the neighbouring towns. A number of married women also travel to work in the towns. The children are bussed to school, the old village school being closed some years ago. Little Bradley has 41 people and 1 child.
